keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Chick-fil-A and the Politics of Eating

snippet: The opening of Chick-fil-A in Manhattan brought out protesters opposed to the company’s politics, but things are never as clear cut as they seem.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column points out hypocrisy of people who refuse to go to fast food restaurant Chick-fil-A on grounds company's owners oppose gay marriage, but who continue to patronize high-end restaurants that rarely employ minorities; notes company pays decent wages and donates to charities; says morality surrounding where to eat has become increasingly complicated.
lead_paragraph: The opening of Chick-fil-A in Manhattan brought out protesters opposed to the company’s politics, but things are never as clear cut as they seem.
